name: ITP 1- In Ground Pressure Services - Polyethylene (Fusion Weld)
template name: ITP 1- In Ground Pressure Services - Polyethylene (Fusion Weld)

name: Survey & Set Out Works
Take dimensions off drawings and record any remarks / deviations
Review Dial Before You Dig information. Ensure not more than 30 days old.
Refer to dimensions on drawings & note any changes. Clearly mark trench line
Inform all personnel of existing services and mark with appropriate coloured paint
Please take a photo of plan title block. Ensure plan number & revision number visible
Excavation & Bedding Materials
Dig trenching to required depth as per AS3500 minimum cover requirements
Ensure minimal over excavation (minimum 75mm below pipe invert)
Lay & compact appropriate bedding material to required thickness, providing a consistent level surface
Install Pipework
Ensure that the pipe to be fused is the correct size for the electrofusion fitting being used
Ensure correct fitting is being used and leave in packaging until ready to install
Cut the pipe ends as evenly and squarely as possible using made for purpose tools
Clean pipe end with isopropyl alcohol to an area that is at least 2 times the full length of the coupling on each pipe end
Scrape pipe end to an area that is at least 2 times the full length of the coupling using made for purpose scraping tool
Ensure proper insertion depth of pipe end into electrofusion coupling
Use assembly clamping if required
Complete weld as per welder/ manufacturer steps
Ensure proper observation of cooling time
Use trace wire for plastic pipes
Lay pipework on bedding material ensuring no sagging in pipework. Multiple pipes keep 100mm Spacing, 300mm for non potable
Test Pipework
Photographic record to be kept of process. Take photos of gauges before and after
Pump test pipework to required kpa and time period as per AS3500 & AS5601.1
For water test pipework to 1500kpa for a period of not less than 30 mins. Ensure no air left in pipelines
For reduced pressure water systems test pipework to manufacturer's specification kpa & time period
For Gas Installations Test pipework to min 7Kpa or 1.5 times the working pressure whichever is greater for min 5min period
For Fire Service Installations Test pipework to min 1700Kpa for 30mins or specified time & pressure
Inspect Pipework
Complete all required inspections by third parties (client, authorities etc) Name/Sign
Work verified by Scente Group
Backfill
Backfill pipework with appropriate material (sand/fine grained soil) not less than 75mm above the pipe soffit when compacted
Place layer warning tape that identifies the specific service 300mm above on compacted backfill directly above pipe
Complete backfill in layers with appropriate material to existing ground level ensuring compaction is achieved via mechanical aids
Photographic Record
Photographic record to be kept of process.Photos to include pipework belly filled and once overlay material installed
Works verified as conforming (McPherson Plumbing Representative):
Work verified by McPherson Plumbing
